translation: Gautama Saṃghadeva Translation of the Tripiṭaka of Kāśmīra, Eastern Jin

source_sentence: （二〇〇）大品阿梨吒經第九(第五後誦)
translation: (20,000) The Ninth Chapter of the Great Ariṣṭa Sutra (Recitation after the Fifth)

source_sentence: 我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I've heard: One time, the Buddha traveled to the country of Śrāvastī and stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿梨吒比丘本伽陀婆梨，生如是惡見：「我知世尊如是說法，行欲者無障礙。」
translation: At the time, the monk Ariṣṭa, originally Gṛdhabādhi, had this bad view, "I know that the Bhagavān thus teaches, and those who practice their desires are unobstructed."

source_sentence: 諸比丘聞已，往至阿梨吒比丘所，問曰：「阿梨吒！
translation: After the monks heard this, they went to the monk Ariṣṭa and asked, "Ariṣṭa!

source_sentence: 汝實如是說：『我知世尊如是說法，行欲者無障礙耶？』」
translation: Is it true that you say, 'I know the Bhagavān thus explains the teaching, and there are no obstacles to those who practice their desires?'"
Ariṣṭa then replied, "Good men!

source_sentence: 我實知世尊如是說法，行欲者無障礙。」
translation: I really know that the Bhagavān thus explains that those who practice their desires are unobstructed."

source_sentence: 諸比丘訶阿梨吒曰：「汝莫作是說，莫誣謗世尊，誣謗世尊者不善，世尊亦不如是說。
translation: The monks reprimanded Ariṣṭa, "Don't say that; don't misrepresent the Bhagavān; a misrepresentation of the Bhagavān is not good, nor does the Bhagavān teach that way.
Ariṣṭa!

source_sentence: 欲有障礙，世尊無量方便說欲有障礙。
translation: "Desire is an obstruction, and the Bhagavān explains that desire is an obstruction in measureless ways.
Ariṣṭa!
You may quickly abandon this bad view."

source_sentence: 阿梨吒比丘為諸比丘所訶已，如此惡見其強力執，而一向說：「此是真實，餘者虛妄。」
translation: After he was reprimanded by those monks, the monk Ariṣṭa held to this bad view forcefully and said to one of them, "This is true; the rest is false."
This was so and so again.

source_sentence: 眾多比丘不能令阿梨吒比丘捨此惡見，從坐起去，往詣佛所，稽首佛足，却坐一面，白曰：「世尊！
translation: Being unable to convince the monk Ariṣṭa to abandon this bad view, they got up from their seats, went to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, withdrew to sit to one side, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 阿梨吒比丘生如是惡見：『我知世尊如是說法：「行欲者無障礙。」』
translation: The monk Ariṣṭa had this bad view, 'I know the Bhagavān thus says, "Engaging in desires is no obstruction."'
Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等聞已，往詣阿梨吒比丘所，問曰：『阿梨吒！
translation: After we heard about it, we went to the monk Ariṣṭa and asked, 'Ariṣṭa!

source_sentence: 汝實如是說：「我知世尊如是說法：『行欲者無障礙耶？』」』
translation: Do you really say, "I know that the Bhagavān thus explains, 'Is there no obstruction for those who practice desire?'"

source_sentence: 阿梨吒比丘答我等曰：『諸賢！
translation: The monk Ariṣṭa answered us, 'Good men!

source_sentence: 我實知世尊如是說法：「行欲者無障礙。」』
translation: I really know that the Bhagavān thus explains, 'Engaging in desires is no obstruction.'
Bhagavān!
We reprimanded him, 'Ariṣṭa!

source_sentence: 汝莫作是說，莫誣謗世尊，誣謗世尊者不善，世尊亦不如是說。
translation: Don't say that; don't misrepresent the Bhagavān; a misrepresentation of the Bhagavān is not good, nor does the Bhagavān teach that way.
Ariṣṭa!

source_sentence: 欲有障礙，世尊無量方便說欲有障礙。
translation: "Desire is an obstruction, and the Bhagavān explains that desire is an obstruction in measureless ways.
Ariṣṭa!
You can quickly abandon this bad view.'

source_sentence: 我等訶已，如此惡見其強力執，而一向說：『此是真實，餘者虛妄。』
translation: After we reprimanded him, he held to this bad view forcefully and said to one of us, 'This is real; the others are false.'
This is how it's done three times.
Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如我等不能令阿梨吒比丘捨此惡見，從坐起去。」
translation: If we were unable to convince the monk Ariṣṭa to abandon this bad view, we got up from our seats and departed."

source_sentence: 世尊聞已，告一比丘：「汝往阿梨吒比丘所，作如是語：『世尊呼汝！』」
translation: After the Bhagavān heard this, he told one of the monks, "Go to that monk Ariṣṭa and say, 'The Bhagavān summons you!'"

source_sentence: 於是，一比丘受世尊教，即從坐起，稽首佛足，遶三匝而去，至阿梨吒比丘所，即語彼曰：「世尊呼汝！」
translation: Then, a monk who had been instructed by the Bhagavān rose from his seat, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, circled him three times, and departed to the monk Ariṣṭa, saying to him, "The Bhagavān summons you!"

source_sentence: 阿梨吒比丘即詣佛所，稽首佛足，却坐一面。
translation: The monk Ariṣṭa went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, and withdrew to sit to one side.
The Bhagavān asked him, "Ariṣṭa!

source_sentence: 實如是說：『我知世尊如是說法：「行欲者無障礙。」
translation: It's true, 'I know the Bhagavān thus says, "Engaging in desires is no obstruction."'
Yeah?'"
Ariṣṭa replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我實知世尊如是說法：『行欲者無障礙。』」
translation: I really know that the Bhagavān thus explains, 'Engaging in desires is no obstruction.'"
The Bhagavān reprimanded him, "Ariṣṭa!
How do you know that I say such things?

source_sentence: 汝從何口聞我如是說法？
translation: From whose mouth did you hear me teach in this way?
You foolish man!

source_sentence: 我不一向說，汝一向說耶？
translation: If I don't say it all the time, will you say it all the time?
You foolish man!

source_sentence: 聞諸比丘共訶，汝時應如法答：『我今當問諸比丘也。』」
translation: When you hear that the monks are reprimanding you, you should answer according to the teaching, 'Now, I will ask the monks.'"

source_sentence: 於是，世尊問諸比丘：「汝等亦如是知我如是說法：『行欲者無障礙。』
translation: The Bhagavān then asked the monks, "Do you also thus know that I thus explain, 'Engaging in desires is no obstruction.'
Is that so?"
The monks then answered, "No."

source_sentence: 世尊問曰：「汝等云何知我說法？」
translation: The Bhagavān asked, "How do you know that I teach?"

source_sentence: 諸比丘答曰：「我等知世尊如是說法：『欲有障礙。』
translation: The monks replied, "We know that the Bhagavān thus explains, 'Desire is an obstruction.'
The Bhagavān says that desire is an obstruction.

source_sentence: 欲如骨鏁，世尊說欲如骨鏁也。
translation: Desire is like a chain of bones," the Bhagavān said, "Desire is like a chain of bones.

source_sentence: 欲如肉臠，世尊說欲如肉臠也。
translation: Desire is like a cut of meat," the Bhagavān says, "Desire is like a cut of meat.

source_sentence: 欲如把炬，世尊說欲如把炬也。
translation: Desire is like holding a torch, and the Bhagavān teaches that desire is like holding a torch.

source_sentence: 欲如火坑，世尊說欲如火坑也。
translation: Desire is like a fire pit, and the Bhagavān teaches that desire is like a fire pit.

source_sentence: 欲如毒蛇，世尊說欲如毒蛇也。
translation: Desire is like a viper, and the Bhagavān teaches that desire is like a viper.

source_sentence: 欲如夢，世尊說欲如夢也。
translation: Desire is like a dream, the Bhagavān says, "Desire is like a dream.

source_sentence: 欲如假借，世尊說欲如假借也。
translation: Desire is like a loan, and the Bhagavān teaches that desire is like a loan.

source_sentence: 欲如樹果，世尊說欲如樹果也。
translation: Desire is like a tree fruit, and the Bhagavān teaches that desire is like a tree fruit.
We know that the Bhagavān thus explains the teaching."
The Bhagavān praised them, "Good!
Bravo!
bhikṣus!
"You know that I say this.
Why is that?
I also say this, 'Desire is an obstruction.'
I say that desire is an obstruction.

source_sentence: 欲如骨鏁，我說欲如骨鏁。
translation: Desire is like a chain of bones, and I say that desire is like a chain of bones.

source_sentence: 欲如肉臠，我說欲如肉臠。
translation: Desire is like a cut of meat, and I say that desire is like a cut of meat.

source_sentence: 欲如把炬，我說欲如把炬。
translation: Desire is like holding a torch, and I say that desire is like holding a torch.

source_sentence: 欲如火坑，我說欲如火坑。
translation: Desire is like a fire pit, and I say that desire is like a fire pit.

source_sentence: 欲如毒蛇，我說欲如毒蛇。
translation: Desire is like a viper, and I say that desire is like a viper.
Desire is like a dream, and I say that desire is like a dream.

source_sentence: 欲如假借，我說欲如假借。
translation: Desire is like a loan, and I say that desire is like a loan.

source_sentence: 欲如樹果，我說欲如樹果。」
translation: Desire is like a tree fruit, and I say that desire is like a tree fruit."
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!
"You know that I explain things this way.

source_sentence: 然此阿梨吒愚癡之人，顛倒受解義及文也。
translation: Still, this foolish man Ariṣṭa is mistaken in how he understands my meaning and words.

source_sentence: 彼因自顛倒受解故，誣謗於我，為自傷害，有犯有罪，諸智梵行者所不憙也，而得大罪。
translation: As a result of his mistaken understanding, he misrepresents me, does harm to himself, commits a crime that wise religious practitioners don't take delight in, and earns a great deal of guilt.
You foolish man!
He knows this is a bad and unwholesome position."

source_sentence: 於是，阿梨吒比丘為世尊面訶責已，內懷憂慼，低頭默然，失辯無言，如有所伺。
translation: After he was personally rebuked by the Bhagavān, the monk Ariṣṭa was dejected at heart, hung his head in silence, and was at a loss for words as he searched for something.

source_sentence: 於是，世尊面訶責數阿梨吒比丘已，告諸比丘：「若我所說法盡具解義者，當如是受持。
translation: After he had personally rebuked that monk Ariṣṭa, the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "If my explanation of the teaching is entirely and fully understood, you must thus maintain it.

source_sentence: 若我所說法不盡具解義者，便當問我及諸智梵行者。
translation: If my explanation of the teaching is not entirely and fully understood, then you must ask me and other wise religious practitioners about it.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 或有癡人，顛倒受解義及文也，彼因自顛倒受解故，如是如是知彼法，謂正經、歌詠、記說、偈他、因緣、撰錄、本起、此說、生處、廣解、未曾有法及說義，彼諍知此義，不受解脫知此義，彼所為知此法，不得此義，但受極苦，唐自疲勞。
translation: "Perhaps there's a deluded person who mistakenly understands the meaning and the words, and as a result of their mistaken understanding, they know the teaching to be 'such and such,' meaning the right sūtras, songs, assurances, verses, causes and conditions, records, legends, lectures, birth places, extensive discourses, unprecedented things, and explanations of meaning, know their meaning in order to debate it, don't know their meaning in order to be liberated, and don't obtain their meaning in order to know it, only to experience suffering and trouble.
Why is that?
That's because they mistakenly understand the teaching.

source_sentence: 「譬若如人，欲得捉蛇，便行求蛇。
translation: "It's like a person who wants to catch a snake, so they go searching for one.

source_sentence: 彼求蛇時，行野林間，見極大蛇，便前以手捉其腰中，蛇迴舉頭，或蜇手足及餘支節。
translation: When they search for a snake, they walk through a wild forest and see a huge snake, so they grab it by its tail, and the snake turns around and raises its head, or it bites their hand, foot, or some other limb.

source_sentence: 彼人所為求取捉蛇，不得此義，但受極苦，唐自疲勞。
translation: That person's attempt to catch a snake doesn't obtain its goal, but they experience extreme pain and trouble.
Why is that?
"It's because they don't well understand how to grasp the serpentine dharma.

source_sentence: 如是或有癡人，顛倒受解義及文也，彼因自顛倒受解故，如是如是知彼法，謂正經、歌詠、記說、偈他、因緣、撰錄、本起、此說、生處、廣解、未曾有法及說義。
translation: Thus, some deluded people mistakenly understand the meaning and the words, and because they mistakenly understand themselves, they know the teaching to be 'such and such,' meaning the right sūtras, songs, assurances, verses, causes and conditions, records, legends, lectures, birth places, extensive discourses, unprecedented things, and explanations of meaning.

source_sentence: 彼諍知此義，不受解脫知此義，彼所為知此法，不得此義，但受極苦，唐自疲勞。
translation: They know their meaning in order to debate it, don't know their meaning in order to be liberated, and don't know their meaning in order to obtain it, but they experience suffering and trouble.
Why is that?
"It's because they mistakenly understand the teaching.

source_sentence: 「或有族姓子，不顛倒善受解義及文，彼因不顛倒善受解故，如是如是知彼法，謂正經、歌詠、記說、偈他、因緣、撰錄、本起、此說、生處、廣解、未曾有法及說義。
translation: "Perhaps there's a clansman who isn't mistaken and well understands the meaning and the words, and because he isn't mistaken and well understands them, he knows the correct sūtras, songs, assurances, verses, causes and conditions, records, legends, lectures, birth places, extensive discourses, unprecedented things, and explanations of meaning to be such and such.

source_sentence: 彼不諍知此義，唯受解脫知此義，彼所為知此法，得此義，不受極苦，亦不疲勞。
translation: They don't know their meaning in order to debate it; they only know their meaning in order to be liberated, and their knowledge of that teaching obtains its goal, so they don't experience suffering and trouble.
Why is that?
It's because they aren't mistaken in how they understand the teaching.

source_sentence: 「譬若如人，欲得捉蛇，便行求蛇。
translation: "It's like a person who wants to catch a snake, so they go out searching for a snake.

source_sentence: 彼求蛇時，手執鐵杖，行野林間，見極大蛇，先以鐵杖押彼蛇頂，手捉其頭，彼蛇雖反尾迴，或纏手足及餘支節，然不能蜇。
translation: When they search for a snake, they carry an iron stick in their hand, walk through a wild forest, and see a huge snake, first pinning the snake's head with the iron stick, and then grabbing its head with their hand, the snake can't bite them even though its tail is twisted around, or it wraps itself around their hand, foot, or other limb.

source_sentence: 彼人所為求取捉蛇，而得此義，不受極苦，亦不疲勞。
translation: That person's attempt to catch the snake obtains its goal, so they don't experience suffering and trouble.
Why is that?
"It's because they well understand the grasping of the serpent's dharma.

source_sentence: 如是或有族姓子，不顛倒善受解義及文，彼因不顛倒善受解故，如是如是知彼法，謂正經、歌詠、記說、偈他、因緣、撰錄、本起、此說、生處、廣解、未曾有法及說義，彼不諍知此義，唯受解脫知此義。
translation: Thus, perhaps there's a clansman who isn't mistaken and well understands the meaning and the words, and because he isn't mistaken and well understands them, he knows the correct sūtras, songs, assurances, verses, causes and conditions, records, legends, lectures, birth places, extensive discourses, unprecedented things, and explanations of meaning, and he doesn't know their meaning in order to debate it but only knows their meaning in order to be liberated.

source_sentence: 彼所為知此法，得此義，不受極苦，亦不疲勞。
translation: Knowing this teaching and attaining its goal, they don't experience suffering and trouble.
Why is that?
It's because they don't mistakenly understand the teaching.

source_sentence: 我為汝等長夜說筏喻法，欲令棄捨，不欲令受故。
translation: For a long time, I've taught you the parable of the raft because I want you to discard the teaching and don't want you to acquire it.

source_sentence: 「云何我為汝等長夜說筏喻法，欲令棄捨，不欲令受？
translation: "How have I taught you the parable of the raft for a long time, wanting you to discard the teaching and not wanting you to acquire it?

source_sentence: 猶如山水甚深極廣，長流駛疾，多有所漂，其中無舡，亦無橋梁。
translation: It's like a mountain river that's deep and wide, has a long, fast-flowing current, and much adrift, and there's no boat or bridge in it.

source_sentence: 或有人來，而於彼岸有事欲度，彼求度時，而作是念：『今此山水甚深極廣，長流駛疾，多有所漂，其中無舡亦無橋梁而可度者，我於彼岸有事欲度，當以何方便，令我安隱至彼岸耶？』
translation: When someone comes along and has something on the other side that they want to cross, they think, 'Now, this mountain river is so deep and wide, its current is long and fast, and there's something floating in it, and there's no boat or bridge, but I have something on the other side that I want to cross, so what method will I use to get myself safely to the other side?'

source_sentence: 復作是念：『我今寧可於此岸邊收聚草木，縛作椑栰，乘之而度。』
translation: "Again, they think, 'Perhaps I could gather a pile of wood and grass on this side, bind it together to make a raft, and ride it across.'

source_sentence: 彼便岸邊收聚草木，縛作椑栰，乘之而度，安隱至彼。
translation: They then gather a pile of wood and grass on the shore, bind it together to make a faggot, ride it across, and reach the other side in comfort.

source_sentence: 便作是念：『今我此栰多有所益，乘此栰已，令我安隱，從彼岸來，度至此岸，我今寧可以著右肩或頭戴去。』
translation: They then think, 'Now, this hedge of mine was quite helpful, and after riding it, it made me comfortable to come from that side and cross over to this one.

source_sentence: 彼便以栰著右肩上或頭戴去。
translation: They then put the barge over their right shoulder or carry it on their head and leave.
What do you think?

source_sentence: 彼作如是竟，能為栰有所益耶？」
translation: After doing this, will it be of help to the raft?"
The monks then answered, "No."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「彼人云何為栰所作能有益耶？
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "How would that person get more help from a raft?

source_sentence: 彼人作是念：『今我此栰多有所益，乘此栰已，令我安隱，從彼岸來，度至此岸。
translation: That person thinks, 'Now, this heave of mine has been quite helpful, and after riding it, it made me comfortable, so I came from that side and crossed over to this one.

source_sentence: 我今寧可更以此栰還著水中，或著岸邊而捨去耶？』
translation: Perhaps I could put this boat back in the water, or perhaps I could put it on the shore and leave it there.'

source_sentence: 彼人便以此栰還著水中，或著岸邊捨之而去。
translation: That man then puts his boat back in the water or puts it on the shore and leaves it.
What do you think?

source_sentence: 彼作如是，為栰所作能有益耶？」
translation: By doing this, will it be helpful for a raft to do what it does?"
The monks then answered, "It'll be helpful."
The Bhagavān told them, "So it is.

source_sentence: 我為汝等長夜說栰喻法，欲令棄捨，不欲令受。
translation: For a long time, I've taught you the parable of the raft, wanting you to discard the teaching and not wanting you to acquire it.

source_sentence: 若汝等知我長夜說栰喻法者，當以捨是法，況非法耶？
translation: If you know that I've taught you this parable for a long time, you will abandon this teaching, so why wouldn't you abandon what's not the teaching?
"Furthermore, there are the six abodes of views.
What are the six?

source_sentence: 比丘者，所有色，過去、未來、現在，或內或外，或精或麤，或妙或不妙，或近或遠，彼一切非我有，我非彼有，亦非是神，如是慧觀，知其如真。
translation: "Monks, regarding all forms, past, future, and present, whether internal or external, fine or coarse, wonderful or not wonderful, near or distant, they are all not possessed by me, I am not possessed by them, nor am I a soul, and thus observing them with insight, they know them as they really are.

source_sentence: 所有覺、所有想、所有此見非我有，我非彼有，我當無，我當不有，彼一切非我有，我非彼有，亦非是神，如是慧觀，知其如真。
translation: "Regarding all feelings, all perceptions, and all views as not possessed by a self, not possessed by a self or by another, which will become nonexistent and which will not exist, all of which are not possessed by a self, I am not possessed by another, and I am not a spirit, he observes them with wisdom and knows them as they really are.

source_sentence: 所有此見，若見聞識知，所得所觀，意所思念，從此世至彼世，從彼世至此世，彼一切非我有，我非彼有，亦非是神，如是慧觀，知其如真。
translation: "Regarding all these views, whether they are seen, heard, recognized, or known, what's obtained and observed, or what's considered by the mind, from this life to that life or from that life to this life, they are all not possessed by me, I am not possessed by them, nor are they the soul, and he observes them with wisdom and knows them as they really are.

source_sentence: 所有此見，此是神，此是世，此是我，我當後世有，常不變易，恒不磨滅法，彼一切非我有，我非彼有，亦非是神，如是慧觀，知其如真。」
translation: He thus sees, 'This is the soul, this is the world, this is me, I will exist in a later life, being permanent and unchanging, and not subject to decay, and all of them are not possessed by me, I am not possessed by them, nor are they the soul, and he observes them with such wisdom and knows them as they really are.'

source_sentence: 於是，有一比丘從坐而起，偏袒著衣，叉手向佛，白曰：「世尊！
translation: Thereupon, a monk rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, saluted the Buddha with his palms together, and said, "Bhagavān!
Is there a cause for having internal fear?"
The Bhagavān answered, "There is."
The monk again asked, "Bhagavān!
What is the cause for having internal fear?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「比丘者，如是見、如是說，彼或昔時無，設有我不得。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "Monks, someone who thus sees and thus speaks might not have existed in the past and couldn't obtain possession of me.

source_sentence: 彼如是見、如是說，憂慼煩勞，啼哭椎胸而發狂癡。
translation: Thus seeing and thus speaking, he becomes sad and troubled, laments and beats his chest, and goes crazy.
Monks!
Thus, within causes there's fear."

source_sentence: 比丘歎世尊已，復問曰：「世尊！
translation: After the monk praised the Bhagavān, he also asked, "Bhagavān!
There might be a cause for having no internal fear."
The Bhagavān answered, "Yes, there is."
The monk again asked, "Bhagavān!
What is the cause for having no internal fear?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「比丘者，不如是見、不如是說，彼或昔時無，設有我不得。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "Monks, someone who doesn't thus see and doesn't thus speak might not have existed in the past, and I wouldn't have been allowed to have them.

source_sentence: 彼不如是見、不如是說，不憂慼，不煩勞，不啼哭，不椎胸，不發狂癡。
translation: He doesn't thus see and doesn't thus speak, so he doesn't become sad and troubled, doesn't lament and beat his chest, and doesn't go crazy.
Monks!
Thus, there's no internal fear."

source_sentence: 比丘歎世尊已，復問曰：「世尊！
translation: After the monk praised the Bhagavān, he also asked, "Bhagavān!
Could it be that there is cause for external fear?"
The Bhagavān answered, "There is."
The monk again asked, "Bhagavān!
What is the cause for having external fear?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「比丘者，如是見、如是說，此是神，此是世，此是我，我當後世有。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "Monks, thus I see and thus I say, 'This is the soul, this is the world, this is me, and I will exist in a later life.'

source_sentence: 彼如是見、如是說，或遇如來，或遇如來弟子，聰明智慧而善言語，成就智慧。
translation: He thus sees and thus speaks, whether he meets the Tathāgata or a disciple of the Tathāgata who's intelligent, wise, speaks well, and has accomplished wisdom.

source_sentence: 彼或如來，或如來弟子，滅一切自身故說法，捨離一切漏、一切我、我所作，滅慢使故說法，彼或如來，或如來弟子，滅一切自身故說法，捨離一切漏、一切我、我所作，滅慢使故說法時，憂慼煩勞，啼哭椎胸而發狂癡，如是說，我斷壞不復有。
translation: When the Tathāgata or the Tathāgata's disciple explains the teaching in order to cease all identity, abandons all contaminants, all that's self, and what's made by self, and explains the teaching in order to cease the tendency of conceit, the Tathāgata or the Tathāgata's disciple explains the teaching in order to cease all identity, abandons all contaminants, all that's self, and what's made by self, and explains the teaching in order to cease the tendency of conceit, the monk becomes sad and troubled, laments and beats his chest, and goes crazy, saying, "I'll be annihilated and never exist again.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼比丘所謂長夜不可愛、不可樂、不可意念，比丘多行彼便憂慼煩勞，啼哭椎胸而發狂癡。
translation: That monk calls a long night unattractive, unenjoyable, and immemorable, and a monk who often does that becomes sad and troubled, laments and beats his chest, and goes crazy.
Monks!
Thus, there's external fear as a result."

source_sentence: 比丘歎世尊已，復問曰：「世尊！
translation: After the monk praised the Bhagavān, he also asked, "Bhagavān!
Is there a cause for having no external fear?"
The Bhagavān answered, "There is."
The monk again asked, "Bhagavān!
What is the cause for having no external fear?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「比丘者，不如是見、不如是說，此是神，此是世，此是我，我當後世有。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "Monks, you don't thus see and don't thus speak, 'This is the soul, this is the world, this is me, and I will exist in a later life.'

source_sentence: 彼不如是見、不如是說，或遇如來，或遇如來弟子，聰明智慧而善言語，成就智慧。
translation: He doesn't thus see and doesn't thus speak, or he meets the Tathāgata or the Tathāgata's disciple who's intelligent, wise, speaks well, and has accomplished wisdom.

source_sentence: 彼或如來，或如來弟子，滅一切自身故說法，捨離一切漏、一切我、我所作，滅慢使故說法，彼或如來，或如來弟子，滅一切自身故說法，捨離一切漏、一切我、我所作，滅慢使故說法時，不憂慼，不煩勞，不啼哭，不椎胸，不發狂癡，不如是說，我斷壞不復有。
translation: When the Tathāgata or the Tathāgata's disciple explains the teaching in order to cease all identity, [says] 'Abandon all contaminants, all that's self, and what's made by self, and cease the tendency of conceit,' the Tathāgata or the Tathāgata's disciple doesn't become sad and troubled, doesn't lament and beat his chest, and doesn't go crazy when he explains the teaching in order to cease all identity, abandon all contaminants, all that's self, and cease the tendency of conceit, so they don't say, 'I'll be destroyed and never exist again.'
Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼比丘所謂長夜可愛、可樂、可意念，比丘多行彼便不憂慼，不煩勞，不啼哭，不椎胸，不發狂癡，比丘！
translation: That monk calls a long night lovely, enjoyable, and memorable, and that monk often does that so that he doesn't become sad and troubled, doesn't lament and beat his chest, and doesn't go crazy, monk!
Thus, there's no fear outside of the cause."

source_sentence: 爾時，比丘歎世尊曰：「善哉！
translation: At that point, the monk praised the Bhagavān, "Good!
Excellent!"

source_sentence: 歎善哉已，聞佛所說，善受持誦，則便默然。
translation: After praising them, they were silent when they heard what the Buddha taught and well accepted and recited it.

source_sentence: 於是，世尊歎諸比丘曰：「善哉！
translation: The Bhagavān then praised the monks, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 比丘受如是所可受，受已，不生憂慼，不煩勞，不啼哭，不椎胸，不發狂癡。
translation: A monk accepts what's thus acceptable and, after accepting it, doesn't become sad and troubled, doesn't lament and beat his chest, and doesn't go crazy.

source_sentence: 汝等見所受所可受，不生憂慼，不煩勞，不啼哭，不椎胸，不發狂癡耶？」
translation: Do you see what you've received and what's acceptable and don't become sad and troubled, lament and beat your chests, or go crazy?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 汝等依如是見所可依，見已，不生憂慼，不煩勞，不啼哭，不椎胸，不發狂癡。
translation: Do you rely on thus seeing what's dependable and, after seeing it, don't become sad and troubled, don't lament and beat your chests, and don't go crazy?

source_sentence: 汝等見依如是見所可依，見已，不生憂慼，不煩勞，不啼哭，不椎胸，不發狂癡耶？」
translation: Do you see that you rely on thus seeing what's dependable and that, after seeing it, you don't become sad and troubled, don't lament and beat your chests, and don't go crazy?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 汝等受如是身，所有身常住不變易、不磨滅法。
translation: Do you accept such a body that's always abiding, unchanging, and not subject to decay?

source_sentence: 汝等見受如是身所可受身已，常住不變易、不磨滅法耶？」
translation: Do you see that after you accept such a body as an acceptable body, it's always abiding, unchanging, and not subject to decay?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 所謂因神故有我，無神見無我，是為神、神所有，不可得、不可施設，及心中有見處、結著、諸使亦不可得，不可施設。
translation: They say that it's because of the soul that there's a self and that without the soul there's no self, and these are the soul and possessions of the soul that can't be obtained or imagined, and the places of views, attachments, and tendencies in the mind that can't be obtained or imagined either.
Monks!

source_sentence: 非為具足說見及見所相續，猶如阿梨吒比丘本為伽陀婆利耶？」
translation: Is it not for the purpose of fully explaining the continuity of views and what is seen, just as if that monk Ariṣṭa had originally been Gṛdhabādhi?"
The monks replied, "So it is.
Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為具足說見及見所相續，猶如阿梨吒比丘本為伽陀婆梨。」
translation: It's a perfect statement of view and what's continuous in view, just as that monk Ariṣṭa was originally Gṛdhabādhi."
"Furthermore, there are the six abodes of views.
What are the six?

source_sentence: 比丘者，所有色，過去、未來、現在，或內或外，或精或麤，或妙或不妙，或近或遠，彼一切非我有，我非彼有，亦非是神。
translation: "Monks, all forms that exist, past, future, and present, whether internal or external, fine or coarse, wonderful or not wonderful, near or distant, are not possessed by me, I am not possessed by them, and I am not the soul.
Wisely observing them this way, he knows them as they really are.

source_sentence: 所有覺行、有想、所有此見，非我有，我非彼有，彼當無我，當不有，彼一切非我有，我非彼有，亦非是神。
translation: 'Regarding all feelings, existent perceptions, and views, they are not possessed by a self, I am not possessed by them, they will become selfless, they will not exist, and they are all not possessed by a self, I am not possessed by them, nor are they the soul.'
Wisely observing them this way, he knows them as they really are.

source_sentence: 所有此見，若見聞識知，所得所觀，意所思念，從此世至彼世，從彼世至此世，彼一切非我有，我非彼有，亦非是神。
translation: 'Regarding this view, whether it's seen, heard, recognized, or known, what's obtained or observed, or what's considered by the mind, from this life to that life or from that life to this life, they are all not possessed by me, I am not possessed by them, nor are they the soul.'
Wisely observing them this way, he knows them as they really are.

source_sentence: 所有此見，此是神，此是世，此是我，我當後世有，常不變易，恒不磨滅法，彼一切非我有，我非彼有，亦非是神。
translation: Whatever this view is, this is the soul, this is the world, this is me, and I will exist in a later life, being permanent and unchanging, and not subject to decay, they are all not possessed by me, I am not possessed by them, nor are they the soul.
Wisely observing them this way, he knows them as they really are.

source_sentence: 「所有比丘，此六見處不見是神，亦不見神所有，彼如是不見已，便不受此世，不受此世已，便無恐怖，因不恐怖已，便得般涅槃，生已盡，梵行已立，所作已辦，不更受有，知如真。
translation: "Suppose a monk sees these six abodes of views and doesn't see that they are possessed by a soul, and after not seeing them that way, he then doesn't accept this world, and after not accepting this world, he has no fear; after he has no fear, he then attains parinirvāṇa, his births have been ended, his religious practice has been established, his task has been accomplished, and he's no longer subject to existence and knows it as it truly is.

source_sentence: 是謂比丘度壍、過壍、破墎、無門、聖智慧鏡。
translation: This is called a monk who has crossed the limit, gone beyond the limit, breached the city wall, has no gate, and is a mirror of noble wisdom.
How has the monk crossed the gauntlet?

source_sentence: 無明壍已盡已知，拔絕根本，打破不復當生，如是比丘得度壍也。
translation: Having ended the veil of ignorance and known it, uprooted it completely, and broken through to no more future birth, such a monk has crossed the veil.
How has the monk crossed the limit?

source_sentence: 有愛已盡已知，拔絕根本，打破不復當生，如是比丘得過壍也。
translation: After he has ended craving and known it, he uprooted it completely and broke through to no more future birth, and thus a monk has gone beyond the limit.
How has the monk breached the city wall?

source_sentence: 無窮生死已盡已知，拔絕根本，打破不復當生，如是比丘得破墎也。
translation: After he has ended endless birth and death and has known it, he uprooted it completely and broke through to no more future birth, and thus the monk has broken through the city wall.
How does the monk have no gate?

source_sentence: 五下分結已盡已知，拔絕根本，打破不復當生，如是比丘得無門也。
translation: Having ended the five lower bonds and known it, uprooted them completely, and broken through to no more future birth, such a monk has no gate.
"What is the monk's mirror of noble wisdom?

source_sentence: 我慢已盡已知，拔絕根本，打破不復當生，如是比丘聖智慧鏡。
translation: Having ended self-conceit and known it, uprooted it from its roots, and broken through to no more future birth, such a monk is a mirror of noble wisdom.

source_sentence: 是謂比丘度壍、過壍、破墎、無門、聖智慧鏡。
translation: This is called a monk who has crossed over the limit, gone beyond the limit, broken through the city wall, has no gate, and is a mirror of noble wisdom.

source_sentence: 「如是正解脫如來，有因提羅及天伊沙那，有梵及眷屬，彼求不能得如來所依識，如來是梵，如來是冷，如來不煩熱，如來是不異。
translation: "Thus, the Tathāgata of right liberation, Indra, the god Īśāna, Brahmā, and their retinues who seek cannot attain the consciousness that the Tathāgata relies upon, that the Tathāgata is Brahmā, that the Tathāgata is cool, that the Tathāgata is not anguished, and that the Tathāgata is not different.

source_sentence: 我如是說：『諸沙門、梵志誣謗我，虛妄言、不真實，沙門瞿曇御無所施設，彼實有眾生，施設斷滅壞，若此中無我不說，彼如來於現法中說無憂。
translation: I thus say, 'Ascetics and priests misrepresent me, speaking falsely and untruthfully, and the ascetic Gautama guides without any supposition that there really are sentient beings whose suppositions are ended, ceased, and destroyed, and if I didn't explain the absence of self here, the Tathāgata would explain the absence of sorrow in the present life.'

source_sentence: 若有他人罵詈如來，撾打如來，瞋恚責數者，如來因彼處不瞋恚、不憎嫉，終無害心。』
translation: If another person ridicules the Tathāgata, assaults the Tathāgata with numerous hateful insults, the Tathāgata causes them not to be hateful or resentful in that place, and they are never harmful.'

source_sentence: 若人罵詈如來，撾打、瞋恚責數時，如來意云何？
translation: If another person ridicules the Tathāgata, assaults him with numerous hateful insults, or assaults him with numerous insults, what does the Tathāgata think?

source_sentence: 如來作是念：『若我本所作、本所造者，因彼致此。』
translation: The Tathāgata thinks, 'If I did something in the past or created something in the past, it's because of that that I've done this.'

source_sentence: 言然罵詈如來，撾打、瞋恚責數者，如來作是意。
translation: The Tathāgata then says this is what he thinks about people who ridicule the Tathāgata and assault him with numerous hateful insults.

source_sentence: 若有他人恭敬如來，供養禮事尊重者，如來因此不以為悅，不以為歡喜，心不以為樂。
translation: If another person respects the Tathāgata and offers support, serves, and venerates him, the Tathāgata is not pleased or encouraged by that, and it doesn't make him happy at heart.

source_sentence: 若他人恭敬如來，供養禮事尊重者，如來意云何？
translation: If another person respects the Tathāgata and offers support, serves, and venerates him, what does the Tathāgata think?

source_sentence: 如來作是念：『若我今所知所斷，因彼致此。』
translation: The Tathāgata thinks this, 'If I've ended what I know now, it's because of that that I've done this.'

source_sentence: 若有他人恭敬如來，供養禮事尊重者，如來作是意。」
translation: This is what the Tathāgata thinks when another person respects the Tathāgata and offers support, serves, and venerates him."

source_sentence: 於是，世尊告諸比丘：「若有他人罵詈汝等，撾打、瞋恚責數者，若有恭敬供養、禮事尊重者，汝等因此亦當莫瞋恚憎嫉，莫起害心，亦莫歡悅歡喜，亦莫心樂。
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed the monks, "If another person ridicules you and assaults you with numerous hateful insults, or if they are respectful, offer support, and serve and venerate you, don't be hateful or resentful because of that, don't become harmful, don't be encouraged or joyous, and don't be happy at heart.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 我等無神、無神所有，猶如今此勝林門外燥草枯木，或有他人持去火燒，隨意所用，於意云何？
translation: We have no soul, and nothing is possessed by a soul, just like the dry grass and withered wood outside the entrance of this Jeta's Grove, or if another person takes it, burns it, or makes use of it as they like, what do you think?

source_sentence: 彼燥草枯木頗作是念：『他人持我去火燒，隨意所用耶？』」
translation: Does that dry grass and withered wood think, 'Will another person carry me away to the fire and burn me as they like?'"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 「如是，若有他人罵詈汝等，撾打、瞋恚責數者，若有恭敬供養、禮事尊重者，汝因此亦當莫瞋恚憎嫉，莫起害心，亦莫歡悅歡喜，亦莫心樂。
translation: "Thus, if another person ridicules you, assaults you with numerous hateful insults, or if they are respectful, offer support, and serve you, don't be hateful or resentful as a result, don't become harmful, don't be encouraged or joyous, and don't be happy at heart.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 我等無神、無神所有，有我法善說，發露廣布，無有空缺，流布宣傳，乃至天人。
translation: We have no soul, nothing possessed by a soul, and our teaching is well expressed, revealed, and disseminated, has nothing pointless, and spreads as it's proclaimed, even up to the heavens.

source_sentence: 如是我法善說，發露廣布，無有空缺，流布宣傳，乃至天人。
translation: Thus, my teaching is well-expounded, revealed, and disseminated, has nothing pointless, and spreads as it's proclaimed, even up to the heavens.

source_sentence: 若正智慧解脫命終者，彼不施設有無窮，我法善說，發露廣布，無有空缺，流布宣傳，乃至天人。
translation: If someone of correct wisdom is liberated, then they don't claim there's something that doesn't end when their life ends, and my teaching is well expressed, revealed, and disseminated, has nothing pointless, and spreads as it's proclaimed, even up to the heavens.

source_sentence: 如是我法善說，發露廣布，無有空缺，流布宣傳，乃至天人。
translation: Thus, my teaching is well expressed, revealed, and disseminated, has nothing pointless, and spreads as it's proclaimed, even up to the heavens.

source_sentence: 若有五下分結盡而命終者，生於彼間，便般涅槃，得不退法，不還此世。
translation: If someone has ended the five lower bonds and their life ends, they'll be born elsewhere, then they'll [enter] parinirvāṇa, attain irreversibility, and not return to this world.

source_sentence: 我法善說，發露廣布，無有空缺，流布宣傳，乃至天人。
translation: My teaching is well expressed, revealed, and disseminated, has nothing pointless, and spreads as it's proclaimed, even up to the heavens.

source_sentence: 如是我法善說，發露廣布，無有空缺，流布宣傳，乃至天人。
translation: Thus, my teaching is well expressed, revealed, and disseminated, has nothing pointless, and spreads as it's proclaimed, even up to the heavens.

source_sentence: 彼三結已盡，婬怒癡薄，得一往來天上人間，一往來已，便得苦邊。
translation: Once they end the three bonds, their lust, hate, and delusion are weakened, and they'll be reborn once up in heaven or among humans, and after that one rebirth, they'll reach the limit of suffering.

source_sentence: 我法善說，發露廣布，無有空缺，流布宣傳，乃至天人。
translation: My teaching is well expressed, revealed, and disseminated, has nothing pointless, and spreads as it's proclaimed, even up to the heavens.

source_sentence: 如是我法善說，發露廣布，無有空缺，流布宣傳，乃至天人。
translation: Thus, my teaching is well expressed, revealed, and disseminated, has nothing pointless, and spreads as it's proclaimed, even up to the heavens.

source_sentence: 彼三結已盡，得須陀洹，不墮惡法，定趣正覺，極七往來天上人間，七往來已，便得苦邊。
translation: Once they end the three bonds, they become a stream entrant, don't fall into bad states, are certainly headed for right awakening, and go up to heaven or among humans for at most seven rebirths, and after those seven rebirths, then they reach the limit of suffering.

source_sentence: 我法善說，發露廣布，無有空缺，流布宣傳，乃至天人。
translation: My teaching is well expressed, revealed, and disseminated, has nothing pointless, and spreads as it's proclaimed, even up to the heavens.

source_sentence: 如是我法善說，發露廣布，無有空缺，流布宣傳，乃至天人。
translation: Thus, my teaching is well expressed, revealed, and disseminated, has nothing pointless, and spreads as it's proclaimed, even up to the heavens.

source_sentence: 若有信樂於我而命終者，皆生善處，如上有餘。」
translation: If someone is faithful and happy with me, then at the end of their life they'll be born in a good place, just like the others."
Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 阿梨吒經第九竟(四千五百七十字)（二〇一）中阿含大品[口*荼]帝經第十(第五後誦)我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園。
translation: Ariṣṭa, the Ninth Complete Sutra (4,570 words) (101) Middle Length Āgamas, Great Chapter [Mouth * Tāna], Tenth Sutra (Recited after the Fifth) I heard this: One time, the Buddha traveled to the country of Śrāvastī and stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove.

source_sentence: 爾時，[口*荼]帝比丘雞和哆子生如是惡見：「我知世尊如是說法：『今此識，往生不更異。』」
translation: At the time, the monk [*Mouth*Ta]ti, Kukkuṭako, had this bad view, "I know the Bhagavān thus taught, 'Now, this consciousness will not be reborn differently in the future.'"

source_sentence: 諸比丘答曰：「我等知世尊如是說法，識因緣故起，世尊說識因緣故起，識有緣則生，無緣則滅，我等知世尊如是說法。」

source_sentence: 我亦如是說，識因緣故起，我說識因緣故起，識有緣則生，無緣則滅，識隨所緣生，即彼緣。
translation: "Thus I also say that consciousness arises because of conditions, and I say that consciousness arises because of conditions, that consciousness arises when there are conditions, ceases when there are no conditions, and that consciousness arises according to its conditions, which are those conditions.

source_sentence: 此所說觀，一曰摶食麤細，二曰更樂，三曰意念，四曰識也。
translation: The contemplations described here are, first, the coarse and fine aspects of resuming food, second, further pleasure, third, mindfulness, and fourth, consciousness.
What are the causes of these four kinds of food and how are they practiced?
Where does it come from?
How does it come about?

source_sentence: 彼四食者，因愛、習愛，從愛而生，由愛有也。
translation: Those four foods cause craving, cultivate craving, arise from craving, and are produced from craving.
What are the causes and habits of craving, and where does it come from?
How does it come about?

source_sentence: 愛者，因覺、習覺，從覺而生，由覺有也。
translation: Aspiration is the result of feelings, the cultivation of feelings, which arise from feelings and are produced from feelings.
What are the causes of feelings and what are their accumulations?
Where does it come from?

source_sentence: 覺者，因更樂、習更樂，從更樂生，由更樂有也。
translation: "Enlightenment is the cause of more pleasure and the cultivation of more pleasure, which arises from more pleasure and is produced by more pleasure.
What are the causes of more pleasure and how is it cultivated?
Where does it come from?
How does it come about?

source_sentence: 更樂者，因六處、習六處，從六處生，由六處有也。
translation: "Further enjoyment is the result of the six sense-fields and the cultivation of the six sense-fields, which arise from the six sense-fields and are produced by the six sense-fields.
What are the causes of the six sense-fields and how are they cultivated?
Where does it come from?
How does it come about?

source_sentence: 六處者，因名色、習名色，從名色生，由名色有也。
translation: "The six sense-fields are caused by name-and-form and the accumulation of name-and-form, which arise from name-and-form and are produced from name-and-form.
What are the causes of name-and-form and how is it cultivated?
Where does it come from?
How does it come about?

source_sentence: 名色者，因識習識，從識而生，由識有也。
translation: "Name and form are caused by consciousness and the formation of consciousness, arise from consciousness, and are produced from consciousness.
What are the causes of consciousness and how is it accumulated?
Where does it come from?
How does it come about?

source_sentence: 識者，因行、習行，從行而生，由行有也。
translation: Consciousness is caused by actions and the accumulation of actions, which arise from actions and are produced by actions.
What are the causes of practice and what are its accumulations?
Where does it come from?
How does it come about?

source_sentence: 行者，因無明、習無明，從無明生，由無明有也。
translation: Action is the cause of ignorance and accumulated ignorance, which arises from ignorance and is produced from ignorance.

source_sentence: 「是為緣無明有行，緣行有識，緣識有名色，緣名色有六處，緣六處有更樂，緣更樂有覺，緣覺有愛，緣愛有受，緣受有有，緣有有生，緣生有老死、愁慼、啼哭、憂苦、懊惱，如是此等大苦陰生。
translation: "It's because of nescience there's form, because of form there's consciousness, because of consciousness there's name-and-form, because of name-and-form there are the six sense-fields, because of the six sense-fields there's more pleasure, because of more pleasure there's awakening, because of awakening there's craving, because of craving there's feeling, because of feeling there's existence, because of existence there's birth, and because of birth there's old age and death, grief, lamentation, sorrow and pain, and vexation, and so forth, the great painful aggregates arise.

source_sentence: 緣生有老死，此說緣生有老死，於汝等意云何？」
translation: What do you think about this teaching that conditioned by birth there's old age and death?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 緣生有老死，我等意如是。
translation: Conditioned by birth there's old age and death, and so we intend it to be.
Why is that?
conditioned by birth there's old age and death."

source_sentence: 「緣有有生，此說緣有有生，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that there's birth by conditions, and there's birth by conditions?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!
'Conditioned by the fact that there is birth, we have this intention.'
Why is that?
Are there conditions for [cognitive] beings to arise?"

source_sentence: 「緣受有有，此說緣受有有，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that conditioned feelings exist and conditioned existences exist?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!
'Conditioned by sensation there is existence, and so we intend it to be.'
Why is that?
conditioned by sensation there's also sensation."

source_sentence: 「緣愛有受，此說緣愛有受，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that conditioned by craving there's sensation, and conditioned by craving there's sensation?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!
conditioned by craving there's sensation, and so we intend it to be.
Why is that?
conditioned by craving there's sensation."

source_sentence: 「緣覺有愛，此說緣覺有愛，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that conditioned feelings have feelings and conditioned feelings have feelings?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!
'Conditioned by awareness there's craving, and so we intend it to be.'
Why is that?
conditioned by feelings there's craving."

source_sentence: 「緣更樂有覺，此說緣更樂有覺，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that there's awakening to the enjoyment of conditions, and then there's awakening to the enjoyment of conditions?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 緣更樂有覺，我等意如是。
translation: We have this intention of realizing that it's preferable to have conditions.
Why is that?
conditioned by going further, there's awakening."

source_sentence: 「緣六處有更樂，此說緣六處有更樂，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that there's further happiness in reference to the six sense-fields and further happiness in reference to the six sense-fields?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 緣六處有更樂，我等意如是。
translation: 'Conditioned by the six sense-fields, there's further pleasure, and so we intend it to be.'
Why is that?
conditioned by the six sense-fields, there are further pleasures."

source_sentence: 「緣名色有六處，此說緣名色有六處，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think of this teaching that there are six perceptual objects in reference to name-and-form and six perceptual objects in reference to name-and-form?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 緣名色有六處，我等意如是。
translation: "Conditioned by name-and-form there are six places, and we have this idea.
Why is that?
Conditioned by name-and-form there are the six sense-fields."

source_sentence: 「緣識有名色，此說緣識有名色，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that conditioned consciousness has name-and-form?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 緣識有名色，我等意如是。
translation: Conditioned by consciousness, there's name-and-form, and so we intend it to be.
Why is that?
Conditioned by consciousness, there's name-and-form."

source_sentence: 「緣行有識，此說緣行有識，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think of this teaching that conditioned by form there's consciousness, and conditioned by form there's consciousness?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!
Conditioned by conditioned activity there's consciousness, and so we intend it to be.
Why is that?
Conditioned on conditioned activity there's consciousness."

source_sentence: 「緣無明有行，此說緣無明有行，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that conditioned on nescience there's volition, and conditioned on nescience there's volition?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 緣無明有行，我等意如是。
translation: It's because nescience has its own formative forces that we have this intention.
Why is that?
It's because of nescience there are formations.

source_sentence: 是為緣無明有行，緣行有識，緣識有名色，緣名色有六處，緣六處有更樂，緣更樂有覺，緣覺有愛，緣愛有受，緣受有有，緣有有生，緣生有老死、愁慼、啼哭、憂苦、懊惱可得生，如是此淳大苦陰生。」
translation: It's because of nescience there are formations, because of formations there's consciousness, because of consciousness there's name-and-form, because of name-and-form there are the six sense-fields, because of the six sense-fields there's more pleasure, because of more pleasure there's awakening, because of awakening there's craving, because of craving there's feeling, because of feeling there's being, because of being there's birth, and because of birth there's old age and death, grief and sorrow, lamentation, grief and pain, and distress that can arise, such are the simple great painful aggregates that arise."
The Bhagavān praised them, "Good!
Bravo!
Bhikṣu!
"You say this.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 我亦如是說，緣無明有行，緣行有識，緣識有名色，緣名色有六處，緣六處有更樂，緣更樂有覺，緣覺有愛，緣愛有受，緣受有有，緣有有生，緣生有老死、愁慼、啼哭、憂苦、懊惱可得生，如是此淳大苦陰生。
translation: I also say in this way that conditioned on nescience there's volition, conditioned on volition there's consciousness, conditioned on consciousness there's name-and-form, conditioned on name-and-form there are the six sense-fields, conditioned on the six sense-fields there's more pleasure, conditioned on more pleasure there's awakening, conditioned on awakening there's craving, conditioned on craving there's feeling, conditioned on feeling there's existence, conditioned on existence there's birth, conditioned on birth there's old age and death, grief and sorrow, lamentation, grief and pain, and distress that can arise, and so on this is simply the birth of the great painful aggregate.

source_sentence: 生滅則老死滅，此說生滅則老死滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: When birth ceases, old age and death cease, and what do you think about this teaching that birth ceases and old age and death cease?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 生滅則老死滅，我等意如是。
translation: When birth ceases, old age and death cease, and so it is in our minds.
Why is that?
When birth ceases, old age and death cease."

source_sentence: 「有滅則生滅，此說有滅則生滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that birth and death cease when there's cessation, and birth and death cease when there's cessation?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 有滅則生滅，我等意如是。
translation: When something ceases, birth ceases, and so do we think.
Why is that?
When there's cessation, birth ceases."

source_sentence: 「受滅則有滅也，此說受滅則有滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "It's when sensation ceases that there's cessation, and what do you think about this teaching that there's cessation when sensation ceases?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 受滅則有滅，我等意如是。
translation: 'When sensation ceases, existence ceases, and so do we think.'
Why is that?
When feelings cease, there's cessation."

source_sentence: 「愛滅則受滅，此說愛滅則受滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that feeling ceases when craving ceases and sensation ceases when craving ceases?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 愛滅則受滅，我等意如是。
translation: When craving ceases, sensation ceases, and so do we think.
Why is that?
When craving ceases, sensation ceases."

source_sentence: 「覺滅則愛滅，此說覺滅則愛滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that when feelings cease, craving ceases and when feelings cease, craving ceases?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 覺滅則愛滅，我等意如是。
translation: When perception ceases, craving ceases, and so do we intend it to be.
Why is that?
When awakening ceases, craving ceases."

source_sentence: 「更樂滅則覺滅，此說更樂滅則覺滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about the statement, 'When further pleasure ceases, awakening ceases,' and the statement, 'When further pleasure ceases, awakening ceases?'"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 更樂滅則覺滅，我等意如是。
translation: Our intention is to cease further delight and then perception will cease.
Why is that?
When further pleasure ceases, then awakening ceases."

source_sentence: 「六處滅則更樂滅，此說六處滅則更樂滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about the statement, 'When the six sense-fields cease, further pleasure ceases, and when the six sense-fields cease, further pleasure ceases?'"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 六處滅則更樂滅，我等意如是。
translation: When the six sense-fields cease, further pleasure ceases, and so do we intend it to be.
Why is that?
When the six sense-fields cease, then further pleasure ceases."

source_sentence: 「名色滅則六處滅，此說名色滅則六處滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that the six sense-fields cease when name-and-form cease and the six sense-fields cease when name-and-form cease?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 名色滅則六處滅，我等意如是。
translation: When name-and-form ceases, the six sense-fields cease, and so do we think.
Why is that?
When name-and-form ceases, the six sense-fields cease."

source_sentence: 「識滅則名色滅，此說識滅則名色滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about the statement that name and form cease when consciousness ceases and that name and form cease when consciousness ceases?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 識滅則名色滅，我等意如是。
translation: When consciousness ceases, name-and-form cease, and so we intend it to be.
Why is that?
When consciousness ceases, name-and-form cease."

source_sentence: 「行滅則識滅，此說行滅則識滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that consciousness ceases when form ceases and consciousness ceases when form ceases?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 行滅則識滅，我等意如是。
translation: When practice ceases, consciousness ceases, and so we think.
Why is that?
When formations cease, consciousness ceases."

source_sentence: 「無明滅則行滅，此說無明滅則行滅，於汝等意云何？」
translation: "What do you think about this teaching that when ignorance ceases, form ceases, and when ignorance ceases, form ceases?"
The monks replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 無明滅則行滅，我等意如是。
translation: When nescience ceases, conditioned activity ceases, and so we intend it to be.
Why is that?
When nescience ceases, conditioned activity ceases.

source_sentence: 是為無明滅則行滅，行滅則識滅，識滅則名色滅，名色滅則六處滅，六處滅則更樂滅，更樂滅則覺滅，覺滅則愛滅，愛滅則受滅，受滅則有滅，有滅則生滅，生滅則老死滅，愁慼、啼哭、憂苦、懊惱可得滅，如是此淳大苦陰滅。」
translation: When nescience ceases, form ceases; when form ceases, consciousness ceases; when consciousness ceases, name-and-form ceases; when name-and-form ceases, the six sense-fields cease; when the six sense-fields cease, more pleasures cease; when more pleasures cease, feelings cease; when feelings cease, feelings cease; when feelings cease, existence ceases; when existence ceases, birth ceases; when birth ceases, old age and death cease; when sorrow, lamentation, grief, pain, and vexation may cease; and thus the simple great aggregate of suffering may cease."
The Bhagavān praised them, "Good!
Bravo!
Bhikṣu!
"You say this.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 我亦如是說，無明滅則行滅，行滅則識滅，識滅則名色滅，名色滅則六處滅，六處滅則更樂滅，更樂滅則覺滅，覺滅則愛滅，愛滅則受滅，受滅則有滅，有滅則生滅，生滅則老死滅，愁慼、啼哭、憂苦、懊惱可得滅，如是此淳大苦陰滅。」
translation: I also say in this way, 'When nescience ceases, form ceases; when form ceases, consciousness ceases; when form ceases, name-and-form ceases; when name-and-form ceases, the six sense-fields cease; when the six sense-fields cease, more pleasures cease; when more pleasures cease, feelings cease; when feelings cease, feelings cease; when feelings cease, existence ceases; when existence ceases, birth ceases; when birth ceases, old age and death cease; when sorrow, lamentation, grief, pain, and vexation may cease; and thus the simple great aggregate of suffering may cease.'
The Bhagavān praised them, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗於過去作是念：『我過去時有，我過去時無。
translation: "If you thus know and thus see, you won't think this about the past: 'When I was here, I was there; when I was gone, I wasn't.'
How was there a time in the past?'
How could it have existed in the past?'"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗於未來作是念：『我未來當有，我未來當無。
translation: If you thus know and thus see, you won't think in the future, 'I will exist in the future, and I will not exist in the future.'
How will there be in the future?'
What will be the cause of future existence?'"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗於內有疑惑，此云何？
translation: If you thus know and thus see, you will have internal doubts, but what do they mean?
What is this?
Where did this sentient being come from?
Where does the destination go?
What cause has already existed?
What cause should there be?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗故殺父母，害弟子阿羅訶，破壞聖眾，惡意向佛出如來血耶？」
translation: If you thus know and thus see, how would you kill your parents, harm your disciple saintly people, and maliciously intend for the Buddha to spill the blood of the Tathāgata?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗故犯戒捨戒罷道耶？」
translation: If you thus know and thus see, why don't you violate the precepts, renounce them, and abandon the path?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗捨此更求外尊求福田耶？」
translation: If you thus know and thus see, will you abandon this and seek external honors and fields of merit?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗作沙門、梵志如是說：『諸尊！
translation: If you thus know and thus see, you will not be ascetics or priests who say, 'Venerables!
Is it possible to know and then know, or to see and then see?'"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗吉祥為清淨耶？」
translation: If you thus know and thus see, are you quite auspicious and pure?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗為諸沙門、梵志，吉祥相應諸見雜苦雜之，雜煩熱雜懊惱，彼是真實耶？」
translation: If you thus know and thus see, wouldn't you be ascetics and priests who auspiciously associate views with mixed suffering and mixed affliction and mixed distress, and is that true?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗身生疹患，生甚重苦，乃至命欲斷，捨此更求外：『頗有彼沙門、梵志，持一句呪，二句、三句、四句、多句、百句，持此呪令脫我苦。』
translation: If you thus know and thus see, you will experience physical pain and suffering so severe that your life will be cut short, and you will seek alternatives to this: 'Could it be that there's an ascetic or priest who holds one dhāraṇī, two, three, four, many, or a hundred dhāraṇīs, and adheres to this dhāraṇī to free me from suffering?'

source_sentence: 是謂求苦、習苦、得苦盡耶？」
translation: Is this called seeking suffering, accumulating suffering, or attaining the end of suffering?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗受八有耶？」
translation: If you thus know and thus see, will you accept eight existences?"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等如是知、如是見，汝等頗如是說：『我等恭敬沙門，敬重沙門，沙門瞿曇是我尊師耶？』」
translation: If you thus know and thus see, will you say, 'We respect and venerate the ascetic, and the ascetic Gautama is my venerable teacher?'"
The monks replied, "No.
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 若汝等自知、自見、自覺得最正覺，汝等隨所問答耶？」
translation: If you know, see, and awaken for yourself and attain supreme perfect enlightenment, will you answer my questions as you see fit?"
The monks replied, "So it is!
Bhagavān!"
The Bhagavān praised him, "Good!
Bravo!

source_sentence: 我正御汝等，於畢究竟無煩無熱，恒不變易法，正智所知、正智所見、正智所覺，因此故我向者說，我為汝說法，畢究竟不煩熱，恒不變易法，正智所知、正智所見、正智所覺。
translation: "I am correctly instructing you that in the final analysis there's no trouble, no fever, and the teaching remains unchanging, and that right knowledge is known, what's seen by right knowledge, and what's perceived by right knowledge; therefore, I'm telling you that I'm teaching you a teaching that's in the final analysis not troubled or feverish, that's always unchanging, and that's known by right knowledge, seen by right knowledge, and perceived by right knowledge.

source_sentence: 復次三事合會入於母胎，父母聚集一處、母滿精堪耐、香陰已至。
translation: Furthermore, when three things come together to enter a mother's womb, their parents gather in one place, the mother is full of energy and endurance, and the fragrant aggregate has arrived.

source_sentence: 此三事合會入於母胎，母胎或持九月十月便生，生已以血長養，血者於聖法中，謂是母乳也。
translation: When these three things come together and enter a mother's womb, that mother's womb might last nine months or ten months and then give birth, and after birth it's nourished by blood, which is called breast milk in the noble teaching.

source_sentence: 彼於後時諸根轉大、根轉成就，食麤飯麨蘇油塗身，彼眼見色，樂著好色、憎惡惡色，不立身念少心心解脫、慧解脫，不知如真，所生惡不善法，不滅盡無餘，不敗壞無餘。
translation: At some point later, their faculties become larger and their faculties become more accomplished, they eat coarse rice and bread, smear their body with oil, their eyes see form, are attracted to good form, hate bad form, don't establish mindfulness of body, have few minds, are liberated by mind and are liberated by wisdom, and don't truly know it, and the bad and unskillful things that arise don't cease without remainder and don't decay without remainder.

source_sentence: 如是耳、鼻、舌、身、意知法，樂著好法、憎惡惡法，不立身念少心心解脫、慧解脫，不知如真，所生惡不善法，不滅盡無餘，不敗壞無餘。
translation: Thus, when the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind perceive things, they are attracted to good qualities and abhor bad qualities, don't establish mindfulness of the body, lessen mental and spiritual liberation, and liberate by wisdom, and don't truly know it as it is, and the resulting bad and unskillful qualities don't cease without remainder and don't decay without remainder.

source_sentence: 彼如是隨憎不憎所受覺，或樂或苦或不苦不樂，彼樂彼覺求著受彼覺，彼樂彼覺求著受彼覺已，若樂覺者是為受，彼緣受有有，緣有有生，緣生有老死，愁慼啼哭憂苦懊惱可得生，如是此淳大苦陰生。
translation: Thus, following feelings that are abhorrent and non-abhorrent, whether pleasant, painful, or neither pleasant, they seek to experience those feelings, and after they enjoy those feelings and seek to experience them, if they enjoy those feelings, this is called experience, conditioned by experience there's existence, conditioned by existence there's birth, conditioned by birth there's old age and death, and birth is possible from grief, lamentation, sorrow, pain, and vexation; thus, this is simply the birth of the great painful aggregate.
Monks!

source_sentence: 非為具足愛所繫相續，如[口*荼]帝比丘雞和哆子耶？」
translation: Is it not a continuous stream of beings bound by perfect love, like [the monk [Mouth*Tathāgata] Kukkuṭapāda?"
The monks replied, "So it is, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 具足愛所繫相續，如[口*荼]帝比丘雞和哆子也。
translation: Possessing a stream of craving, he's like [Mouth*Taŋ] Tejorāṣi, the monk Kukkuṇḍaṭako.

source_sentence: 若時如來出世，無所著、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，號佛、眾祐。
translation: If the Tathāgata then appears in the world, he's unattached, perfectly enlightened, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, well gone, a worldly saver, an unsurpassed person, a trainer of the way, and a teacher of gods and humans, he's called a Buddha and a Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 彼眼見色，於好色而不樂著，於惡色而不憎惡，立身念無量心，心解脫、慧解脫，知如真，所生惡不善法，滅盡無餘，敗壞無餘。
translation: When the eye sees form, it doesn't delight in good form and doesn't hate bad form, establishes itself in mindfulness of measureless thought, liberates the mind and liberates wisdom, and knows it as it truly is, and the bad and unskillful qualities that arise are ceased without remainder and corrupted without remainder.

source_sentence: 如是耳、鼻、舌、身、意知法，不著好法、不惡惡法，立身念無量心，心解脫、慧解脫，知如真，所生惡不善法，滅盡無餘，敗壞無餘。
translation: Thus, when they hear, nose, tongue, body, and mind know things, don't attach to good qualities and don't hate bad qualities, establish mindfulness of body without measure, are liberated in mind and liberated by wisdom, and know it as it really is, the bad and unskillful qualities that arise are ceased without remainder and corrupted without remainder.

source_sentence: 彼如是滅憎不憎所受覺，或樂或苦或不苦不樂，彼不樂彼覺，不求不著不受覺，彼不樂彼覺，不求不著不受覺已，若樂覺者彼便滅，樂滅則受滅，受滅則有滅，有滅則生滅，生滅則老死滅，愁慼啼哭憂苦懊惱可得滅，如是此淳大苦陰滅。」
translation: They thus cease the feelings they experience as abhorrent, whether pleasant, painful, or neither pleasant, don't enjoy those feelings, don't seek or attach to them, and don't experience them after they don't enjoy them and don't seek or attach to them; if they enjoy those feelings, they then cease; when their enjoyment ceases, feelings cease; when feelings cease, existence ceases; when existence ceases, birth ceases; when birth ceases, old age and death cease; when sorrow and lamentation cease, grief and pain and vexation may cease; thus, this is simply the cessation of the great aggregate of suffering."
"Monks!
Isn't it the full completion of craving and liberation?"
The monks replied, "So it is, Bhagavān!
They'll be completely liberated by the fulfillment of craving."

source_sentence: 說是法時，此三千大千世界三反震動，動、盡動，戰、盡戰，震、盡震。
translation: When this teaching was spoken, these 3,000 great one-thousand worlds shook three times, moving and completely shaking, fighting and completely fighting, and shaking and completely shaking.
This is why the sūtra calls it the liberation of craving's end.
Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: [口*荼]帝經第十竟(四千六百九十一字)中阿含經卷第五十四(九千三百六十一字)中阿含大品第二竟(三萬九千九百一十二字)(第五後誦)
translation: [Mouth*Ta]ti jing xing (4,691 words) Zhong ahan jing roll 54 (9,361 words) Zhong ahan dapin yijing (39,912 words) (recited after the fifth)
